member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.Destroy
member.summary: Destroys this component by purging any event listeners, removing the component's element from the DOM, removing the component from its Ext.Container (if applicable) and unregistering it from Ext.ComponentMgr. Destruction is generally handled automatically by the framework and this method should usually not need to be called directly.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.AutoEl
member.summary: A tag name or DomHelper spec to create an element with. This is intended to create shorthand utility components inline via JSON. It should not be used for higher level components which already create their own elements.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.AutoShow
member.summary: True if the component should check for hidden classes (e.g. 'x-hidden' or 'x-hide-display') and remove them on render (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.ClearCls
member.summary: The CSS class used to provide field clearing (defaults to 'x-form-clear-left').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.Cls
member.summary: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to this component's Element (defaults to ''). This can be useful for adding customized styles to the component or any of its children using standard CSS rules.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.CtCls
member.summary: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to this component's contentContainer (defaults to ''). This can be useful for adding customized styles to the contentContainer or any of its children using standard CSS rules.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.Disabled
member.summary: Render this component disabled (default is false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.DisabledClass
member.summary: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to 'x-items-disabled').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.FieldLabel
member.summary: The label text to display next to this field (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.Hidden
member.summary: Render this component hidden (default is false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.HideLabel
member.summary: True to completely hide the label element (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.HideMode
member.summary: How this component should be hidden. Supported values are 'visibility' (css visibility), 'offsets' (negative offset position) and 'display' (css display) - defaults to 'display'.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.HideParent
member.summary: True to hide and show the component's contentContainer when hide/show is called on the component, false to hide and show the component itself (defaults to false)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.ItemCls
member.summary: An additional CSS class to apply to this field (defaults to the contentContainer's itemCls value if set, or '').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.LabelCls
member.summary: An additional CSS class to apply to this field form label.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.LabelSeparator
member.summary: The standard separator to display after the text of each form label (defaults is a colon ':'). To display no separator for this field's label specify empty string ''.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.LabelStyle
member.summary: A CSS style specification to apply directly to this field's label (defaults to the contentContainer's labelStyle value if set, or ''). For example, labelStyle: 'font-weight:bold;'.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.OverCls
member.summary: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to this component's Element when the mouse moves over the Element, and removed when the mouse moves out. (defaults to ''). This can be useful for adding customized 'active' or 'hover' styles to the component or any of its children using standard CSS rules.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.Plugins
member.summary: An object or array of controls that inherit from IPlugin that will provide custom functionality for this component. The only requirement for a valid plugin is that it contain an init method that accepts a reference of type Ext.Component. When a component is created, if any plugins are available, the component will call the init method on each plugin, passing a reference to itself. Each plugin can then call methods or respond to events on the component as needed to provide its functionality.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.RenderTo
member.summary: The id of the node, a DOM node or an existing Element that will be the contentContainer to render this component into.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.AutoRender
member.summary: Automatically render control on client during page load. Default is true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.CustomRenderTo
member.summary: A custom value for the renderTo config property. Wrap value with ={value_here} token if you require the value to be rendered as a raw string, otherwise the value will be wrapped in \"\".

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.StateEvents
member.summary: An array of events that, when fired, should trigger this component to save its state (defaults to none). These can be any types of events supported by this component, including browser or custom events (e.g., ['click', 'customerchange']).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.StateID
member.summary: The unique id for this component to use for state management purposes (defaults to the component id).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Component.Stateful
member.summary: A flag which causes the Component to attempt to restore the state of internal properties from a saved state on startup.

member.summary: A custom style specification to be applied to this component's Element.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.Add(Coolite.Ext.Web.Component)
member.summary: Adds a component to this container. Fires the beforeadd event before adding, then fires the add event after the component has been added. If the container is already rendered when add is called, you may need to call doLayout to refresh the view. This is required so that you can add multiple child components if needed while only refreshing the layout once.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.Bubble(System.String)
member.summary: Bubbles up the component/container heirarchy, calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.Bubble(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Bubbles up the component/container heirarchy, calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.Bubble(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Bubbles up the component/container heirarchy, calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the bubble is stopped.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.Cascade(System.String)
member.summary: Cascades down the component/container heirarchy from this component (called first), calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.Cascade(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Cascades down the component/container heirarchy from this component (called first), calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.Cascade(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Cascades down the component/container heirarchy from this component (called first), calling the specified function with each component. The scope (this) of function call will be the scope provided or the current component. The arguments to the function will be the args provided or the current component. If the function returns false at any point, the cascade is stopped on that branch.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.DoLayout
member.summary: Force this container's layout to be recalculated. A call to this function is required after adding a new component to an already rendered container, or possibly after changing sizing/position properties of child components.

member.summary: Force this container's layout to be recalculated. A call to this function is required after adding a new component to an already rendered container, or possibly after changing sizing/position properties of child components.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.ActiveItem
member.summary: A string component id or the numeric index of the component that should be initially activated within the contentContainer's layout on render.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.ActiveIndex
member.summary: A string component id or the numeric index of the component that should be initially activated within the contentContainer's layout on render.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.AutoDestroy
member.summary: If true the contentContainer will automatically destroy any contained component that is removed from it, else destruction must be handled manually (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.BufferResize
member.summary: When set to true (100 milliseconds) or a number of milliseconds, the layout assigned for this contentContainer will buffer the frequency it calculates and does a re-layout of components. This is useful for heavy containers or containers with a large amount of sub components that frequent calls to layout are expensive.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.DefaultType
member.summary: The default type of contentContainer represented by this object as registered in Ext.ComponentMgr (defaults to 'panel').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.Defaults
member.summary: A config object that will be applied to all components added to this contentContainer either via the items config or via the add or insert methods. The defaults config can contain any number of name/value property pairs to be added to each items, and should be valid for the types of items being added to the contentContainer. For example, to automatically apply padding to the body of each of a set of contained Ext.Panel items, you could pass: defaults: {bodyStyle:'padding:15px'}.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.HideBorders
member.summary: True to hide the borders of each contained component, false to defer to the component's existing border settings (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Container.MonitorResize
member.summary: True to automatically monitor window resize events to handle anything that is sensitive to the current size of the viewport. This value is typically managed by the chosen layout and should not need to be set manually.

member.summary: Items Collection

member.summary: A valid url spec according to the UpdateOptions Ext.UpdateOptions.update method. If autoLoad is not null, the panel will attempt to load its contents immediately upon render. The URL will become the default URL for this panel's body element, so it may be refreshed at any time.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.AutoScroll
member.summary: True to use overflow:'auto' on the panel's body element and show scroll bars automatically when necessary, false to clip any overflowing content (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.BaseCls
member.summary: The base CSS class to apply to this panel's element (defaults to 'x-panel').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.BottomBar
member.summary: The bottom toolbar of the panel.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.BodyBorder
member.summary: True to display an interior border on the body element of the panel, false to hide it (defaults to true). This only applies when border == true. If border == true and bodyBorder == false, the border will display as a 1px wide inset border, giving the entire body element an inset appearance.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.BodyStyle
member.summary: Custom CSS styles to be applied to the body element in the format expected by Ext.Element.applyStyles (defaults to null).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Border
member.summary: True to display the borders of the panel's body element, false to hide them (defaults to true). By default, the border is a 2px wide inset border, but this can be further altered by setting bodyBorder to false.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.ButtonAlign
member.summary: Valid values are "left", "center" and "right" (defaults to "right").

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Buttons
member.summary: A collection of buttons configs used to add buttons to the footer of this panel

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.CollapseFirst
member.summary: True to make sure the collapse/expand toggle button always renders first (to the left of) any other tools in the panel's title bar, false to render it last (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Collapsed
member.summary: True to render the panel collapsed, false to render it expanded (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.CollapsedCls
member.summary: A CSS class to add to the panel's element after it has been collapsed (defaults to 'x-panel-collapsed').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Collapsible
member.summary: True to make the panel collapsible and have the expand/collapse toggle button automatically rendered into the header tool button area, false to keep the panel statically sized with no button (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Draggable
member.summary: True to enable dragging of this Panel (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Elements
member.summary: A comma-delimited list of panel elements to initialize when the panel is rendered.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Floating
member.summary: True to float the panel (absolute position it with automatic shimming and shadow), false to display it inline where it is rendered (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Footer
member.summary: True to create the footer element explicitly, false to skip creating it. By default, when footer is not specified, if one or more buttons have been added to the panel the footer will be created automatically, otherwise it will not.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Frame
member.summary: True to render the panel with custom rounded borders, false to render with plain 1px square borders (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Header
member.summary: True to create the header element explicitly, false to skip creating it. By default, when header is not specified, if a title is set the header will be created automatically, otherwise it will not. If a title is set but header is explicitly set to false, the header will not be rendered.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.HeaderAsText
member.summary: True to display the panel title in the header, false to hide it (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.HideCollapseTool
member.summary: True to hide the expand/collapse toggle button when collapsible = true, false to display it (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Html
member.summary: An HTML fragment, or a DomHelper specification to use as the panel's body content (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Icon
member.summary: The icon to use in the Title bar. See also, IconCls to set an icon with a custom Css class.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.IconCls
member.summary: A CSS class that will provide a background image to be used as the panel header icon (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.KeyMap
member.summary: A KeyMap config object (in the format expected by Ext.KeyMap.addBinding used to assign custom key handling to this panel (defaults to null).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.MaskDisabled
member.summary: True to mask the panel when it is disabled, false to not mask it (defaults to true). Either way, the panel will always tell its contained elements to disable themselves when it is disabled, but masking the panel can provide an additional visual cue that the panel is disabled.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.MinButtonWidth
member.summary: Minimum width in pixels of all buttons in this panel (defaults to 75).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Shadow
member.summary: ShadowMode to display a shadow behind the panel. Note that this option only applies when floating = true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.ShadowOffset
member.summary: The number of pixels to offset the shadow if displayed (defaults to 4). Note that this option only applies when floating = true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Shim
member.summary: False to disable the iframe shim in browsers which need one (defaults to true). Note that this option only applies when floating = true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.TabTip
member.summary: Adds a tooltip when mousing over the tab of a Ext.Panel which is an item of a Ext.TabPanel. Ext.QuickTips.init() must be called in order for the tips to render.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.LoadMask
member.summary: An Ext.LoadMask to mask the Panel while loading (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.Title
member.summary: The title text to display in the panel header (defaults to ''). When a title is specified the header element will automatically be created and displayed unless header is explicitly set to false. If you don't want to specify a title at config time, but you may want one later, you must either specify a non-empty title (a blank space ' ' will do) or header:true so that the contentContainer element will get created.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelBase.TitleCollapse
member.summary: True to allow expanding and collapsing the panel (when collapsible = true) by clicking anywhere in the header bar, false to allow it only by clicking to tool button (defaults to false).

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ContentPanel.UpdateBody(System.String)
member.summary: Updates the content of the Panel body with the supplied string ('text') value. Same as the .SetHtml(html) Method.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ContentPanel.ContentEl
member.summary: The id of an existing HTML node to use as the panel's body content (defaults to '').

member.summary: Id or element from which the window should animate while opening (defaults to null with no animation).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Closable
member.summary: True to display the 'close' tool button and allow the user to close the window, false to hide the button and disallow closing the window (default to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.CloseAction
member.summary: The action to take when the close button is clicked. The default action is 'close' which will actually remove the window from the DOM and destroy it. The other valid option is 'hide' which will simply hide the window by setting visibility to hidden and applying negative offsets, keeping the window available to be redisplayed via the show method.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Constrain
member.summary: True to constrain the window to the viewport, false to allow it to fall outside of the viewport (defaults to false). Optionally the header only can be constrained using ConstrainHeader.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.ConstrainHeader
member.summary: True to constrain the window header to the viewport, allowing the window body to fall outside of the viewport, false to allow the header to fall outside the viewport (defaults to false). Optionally the entire window can be constrained using constrain.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.DefaultButton
member.summary: The id of a button to focus when this window received the focus.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Draggable
member.summary: True to allow the window to be dragged by the header bar, false to disable dragging (defaults to true). Note that by default the window will be centered in the viewport, so if dragging is disabled the window may need to be positioned programmatically after render (e.g., myWindow.setPosition(100, 100);).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.ExpandOnShow
member.summary: True to always expand the window when it is displayed, false to keep it in its current state (which may be collapsed) when displayed (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Maximizable
member.summary: True to display the 'maximize' tool button and allow the user to maximize the window, false to hide the button and disallow maximizing the window (defaults to false). Note that when a window is maximized, the tool button will automatically change to a 'restore' button with the appropriate behavior already built-in that will restore the window to its previous size.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Height
member.summary: The height of this component in pixels (defaults to auto).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.MinHeight
member.summary: The minimum height in pixels allowed for this window (defaults to 100).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Width
member.summary: The width of this component in pixels (defaults to auto).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.MinWidth
member.summary: The minimum width in pixels allowed for this window (defaults to 200). Only applies when resizable = true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Minimizable
member.summary: True to display the 'minimize' tool button and allow the user to minimize the window, false to hide the button and disallow minimizing the window (defaults to false). Note that this button provides no implementation -- the behavior of minimizing a window is implementation-specific, so the minimize event must be handled and a custom minimize behavior implemented for this option to be useful.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Modal
member.summary: True to make the window modal and mask everything behind it when displayed, false to display it without restricting access to other UI elements (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.OnEsc
member.summary: Allows override of the built-in processing for the escape key. Default action is to close the Window (performing whatever action is specified in closeAction. To prevent the Window closing when the escape key is pressed, specify this as Ext.emptyFn (See Ext.emptyFn).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Plain
member.summary: True to render the window body with a transparent background so that it will blend into the framing elements, false to add a lighter background color to visually highlight the body element and separate it more distinctly from the surrounding frame (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.Resizable
member.summary: True to allow user resizing at each edge and corner of the window, false to disable resizing (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.WindowBase.ResizeHandles
member.summary:
A valid Ext.Resizable handles config string (defaults to 'all'). Only applies when resizable = true.
Value Description ------ ------------------- 'n' north 's' south 'e' east 'w' west 'nw' northwest 'sw' southwest 'se' southeast 'ne' northeast 'all' all

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.Accordion
member.summary: This is a base class for layouts that contain a single items that automatically expands to fill the layout's contentContainer. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout:'fit' Ext.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword. FitLayout does not have any direct config options (other than inherited ones). To fit a panel to a contentContainer using FitLayout, simply set layout:'fit' on the contentContainer and add a single panel to it. If the contentContainer has multiple panels, only the first one will be displayed.

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.ContainerLayout
member.summary: Every layout is composed of one or more Ext.Container elements internally, and ContainerLayout provides the basic foundation for all other layout classes in Ext. It is a non-visual class that simply provides the base logic required for a Container to function as a layout.

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.Layout
member.summary: Every layout is composed of one or more Ext.Container elements internally, and Layout provides the basic foundation for all other layout classes in Ext. It is a non-visual class that simply provides the base logic required for a Container to function as a layout.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Layout.LayoutType
member.summary: The layout type to be used in this Body Container. If not specified, a default is Container. Specific config values for the chosen layout type can be specified using layoutConfig.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Layout.ExtraCls
member.summary: An optional extra CSS class that will be added to the contentContainer (defaults to ''). This can be useful for adding customized styles to the contentContainer or any of its children using standard CSS rules.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Layout.RenderHidden
member.summary: True to hide each contained items on render (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Layout.Items
member.summary: Items collection

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ContainerLayout.ActiveItem
member.summary: A string component id of the component that should be initially activated within the contentContainer's layout on render.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ContainerLayout.ActiveIndex
member.summary: A numeric index of the component that should be initially activated within the contentContainer's layout on render.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Accordion.ActiveOnTop
member.summary: True to swap the position of each panel as it is expanded so that it becomes the first items in the contentContainer, false to keep the panels in the rendered order. This is NOT compatible with 'animate:true' (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Accordion.Animate
member.summary: True to slide the contained panels open and closed during expand/collapse using animation, false to open and close directly with no animation (defaults to false). Note: to defer to the specific config setting of each contained panel for this property, set this to undefined at the layout level.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Accordion.AutoWidth
member.summary: True to set each contained items's width to 'auto', false to use the items's current width (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Accordion.CollapseFirst
member.summary: True to make sure the collapse/expand toggle button always renders first (to the left of) any other tools in the contained panels' title bars, false to render it last (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Accordion.Fill
member.summary: True to adjust the active items's height to fill the available space in the contentContainer, false to use the items's current height, or auto height if not explicitly set (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Accordion.HideCollapseTool
member.summary: True to hide the contained panels' collapse/expand toggle buttons, false to display them (defaults to false). When set to true, titleCollapse should be true also.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Accordion.Sequence
member.summary: Experimental. If animate is set to true, this will result in each animation running in sequence.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Accordion.TitleCollapse
member.summary: True to allow expand/collapse of each contained panel by clicking anywhere on the title bar, false to allow expand/collapse only when the toggle tool button is clicked (defaults to true). When set to false, hideCollapseTool should be false also.

member.name: F:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.renderer
member.summary:
(optional) A function used to generate HTML markup for a cell given the cell's data value. If not specified, the default renderer uses the raw data value.
Sets the rendering (formatting) function for a column. See Ext.util.Format for some default formatting functions.
The render function is called with the following parameters: value : Object The data value for the cell. metadata : Object An object in which you may set the following attributes:
css : String A CSS class name to add to the cell's TD element. attr : String An HTML attribute definition string to apply to the data container element within the table cell (e.g. 'style="color:red;"').
record : Ext.data.record The Ext.data.Record from which the data was extracted. rowIndex : Number Row index colIndex : Number Column index store : Ext.data.Store The Ext.data.Store object from which the Record was extracted. Returns: void

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Align
member.summary: optional) Set the CSS text-align property of the column. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Css
member.summary: (optional) Set custom CSS for all table cells in the column (excluding headers). Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.DataIndex
member.summary: (optional) The name of the field in the grid's Store's Record definition from which to draw the column's value. If not specified, the column's index is used as an index into the Record's data Array.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Editor
member.summary: (optional) The Field to use when editing values in this column if editing is supported by the grid.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Fixed
member.summary: (optional) True if the column width cannot be changed. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Header
member.summary: The header text to display in the Grid view.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Hidden
member.summary: (optional) True to hide the column. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Hideable
member.summary: (optional) Specify as false to prevent the user from hiding this column. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.ColumnID
member.summary:
(optional) Defaults to the column's initial ordinal position. A name which identifies this column. The id is used to create a CSS class name which is applied to all table cells (including headers) in that column. The class name takes the form of
x-grid3-td-id
Header cells will also recieve this class name, but will also have the class x-grid3-hd, so to target header cells, use CSS selectors such as:
.x-grid3-hd.x-grid3-td-id
The AutoExpandColumn grid config option references the column via this identifier.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.MenuDisabled
member.summary: (optional) True to disable the column menu. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Groupable
member.summary: (optional) False to disable grouping by this column. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Resizable
member.summary: (optional) False to disable column resizing. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Sortable
member.summary: (optional) True if sorting is to be allowed on this column. Defaults to the value of the defaultSortable property. Whether local/remote sorting is used is specified in Ext.data.Store.remoteSort.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Tooltip
member.summary: (optional) A text string to use as the column header's tooltip. If Quicktips are enabled, this value will be used as the text of the quick tip, otherwise it will be set as the header's HTML title attribute. Defaults to ''.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnBase.Width
member.summary: (optional) The initial width in pixels of the column. Using this instead of Ext.grid.GridPanel.autoSizeColumns is more efficient.

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.TriggerFieldBase
member.summary: Provides a convenient wrapper for TextFields that adds a clickable trigger button (looks like a combobox by default). The trigger has no default action, so you must assign a function to implement the trigger click handler by overriding onTriggerClick. You can create a TriggerField directly, as it renders exactly like a combobox for which you can provide a custom implementation.

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase
member.summary: Base Class for all Text Field Web Controls.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.Reset
member.summary: Resets the current field value to the originally-loaded value and clears any validation messages. Also adds emptyText and emptyClass if the original value was blank.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.AutoSize
member.summary: Automatically grows the field to accomodate the width of the text up to the maximum field width allowed. This only takes effect if grow = true, and fires the autosize event.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.SelectText
member.summary: Selects text in this field

member.summary: Selects text in this field

member.summary: Selects text in this field

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.AllowBlank
member.summary: False to validate that the value length > 0 (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.BlankText
member.summary: Error text to display if the allow blank validation fails (defaults to 'This field is required').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.DisableKeyFilter
member.summary: True to disable input keystroke filtering (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.EmptyClass
member.summary: The CSS class to apply to an empty field to style the emptyText (defaults to 'x-form-empty-field'). This class is automatically added and removed as needed depending on the current field value.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.EmptyText
member.summary: The default text to display in an empty field (defaults to null).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.EnableKeyEvents
member.summary: True to enable the proxying of key events for the HTML input field (defaults to false)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.Grow
member.summary: True if this field should automatically grow and shrink to its content (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.GrowMax
member.summary: The maximum width to allow when grow = true (defaults to 800).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.GrowMin
member.summary: The minimum width to allow when grow = true (defaults to 30).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.InputType
member.summary: The type attribute for input fields.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.MaskRe
member.summary: An input mask regular expression that will be used to filter keystrokes that don't match (defaults to null).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.MaxLength
member.summary: Maximum input field length allowed (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.MaxLengthText
member.summary: Error text to display if the maximum length validation fails (defaults to 'The maximum length for this field is {maxLength}').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.MinLength
member.summary: Minimum input field length required (defaults to 0).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.MinLengthText
member.summary: Error text to display if the minimum length validation fails (defaults to 'The minimum length for this field is {minLength}').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.Regex
member.summary: A JavaScript RegExp object to be tested against the field value during validation (defaults to null). If available, this regex will be evaluated only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the current field value. If the test fails, the field will be marked invalid using RegexText.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.RegexText
member.summary: The error text to display if regex is used and the test fails during validation (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.SelectOnFocus
member.summary: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.Truncate
member.summary: If MaxLength property has been set, more characters than the MaxLength can be entered if Truncate='false'. If 'false', then a validation error is rendered if more characters entered (or pasted) than the MaxLength property. Default value is 'true'.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.Validator
member.summary: A custom validation function to be called during field validation (defaults to null). If available, this function will be called only after the basic validators all return true, and will be passed the current field value and expected to return boolean true if the value is valid or a string error message if invalid.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.Vtype
member.summary: A validation type name as defined in Ext.form.VTypes (defaults to null).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TextFieldBase.VtypeText
member.summary: A custom error message to display in place of the default message provided for the vtype currently set for this field (defaults to ''). Only applies if vtype is set, else ignored.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TriggerFieldBase.HideTrigger
member.summary: True to hide the trigger element and display only the base text field (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.TriggerFieldBase.TriggerClass
member.summary: A CSS class to apply to the trigger.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.SetValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets a data value into the field and validates it. To set the value directly without validation see setRawValue.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.AllQuery
member.summary: The text query to send to the server to return all records for the list with no filtering (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.DisplayField
member.summary: The underlying data field name to bind to this ComboBox (defaults to undefined if mode = 'remote' or 'text' if transforming a select).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.Editable
member.summary: False to prevent the user from typing text directly into the field, just like a traditional select (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.ForceSelection
member.summary: True to restrict the selected value to one of the values in the list, false to allow the user to set arbitrary text into the field (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.HandleHeight
member.summary: The height in pixels of the dropdown list resize handle if resizable = true (defaults to 8).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.HiddenName
member.summary: If specified, a hidden form field with this name is dynamically generated to store the field's data value (defaults to the underlying DOM element's name). Required for the combo's value to automatically post during a form submission.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.ItemSelector
member.summary: This setting is required if a custom XTemplate has been specified in tpl which assigns a class other than 'x-combo-list-item' to dropdown list items. A simple CSS selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child) that will be used to determine what nodes the DataView which handles the dropdown display will be working with.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.LazyInit
member.summary: True to not initialize the list for this combo until the field is focused. (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.LazyRender
member.summary: True to prevent the ComboBox from rendering until requested (should always be used when rendering into an Ext.Editor, defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.FireSelectOnLoad
member.summary: True to fire select event after setValue on page load

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.ListAlign
member.summary: A valid anchor position value. See Ext.Element.alignTo for details on supported anchor positions (defaults to 'tl-bl').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.ListClass
member.summary: CSS class to apply to the dropdown list element (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.ListWidth
member.summary: The width in pixels of the dropdown list (defaults to the width of the ComboBox field).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.LoadingText
member.summary: The text to display in the dropdown list while data is loading. Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 'Loading...').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.MaxHeight
member.summary: The maximum height in pixels of the dropdown list before scrollbars are shown (defaults to 300).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.MinChars
member.summary: The minimum number of characters the user must type before autocomplete and typeahead activate (defaults to 4 if remote or 0 if local, does not apply if editable = false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.MinListWidth
member.summary: The minimum width of the dropdown list in pixels (defaults to 70, will be ignored if listWidth has a higher value).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.Mode
member.summary: Set to 'local' if the ComboBox loads local data (defaults to 'remote' which loads from the server).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.PageSize
member.summary: If greater than 0, a paging toolbar is displayed in the footer of the dropdown list and the filter queries will execute with page addToStart and limit parameters. Only applies when mode = 'remote' (defaults to 0).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.QueryDelay
member.summary: The length of time in milliseconds to delay between the addToStart of typing and sending the query to filter the dropdown list (defaults to 500 if mode = 'remote' or 10 if mode = 'local').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.QueryParam
member.summary: Name of the query as it will be passed on the querystring (defaults to 'query').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.SelectedClass
member.summary: CSS class to apply to the selected items in the dropdown list (defaults to 'x-combo-selected').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.Shadow
member.summary: 'Sides' for the default effect, 'Frame' for 4-way shadow, and 'Drop' for bottom-right.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.SelectOnFocus
member.summary: True to automatically select any existing field text when the field receives input focus (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.Template
member.summary: The template string to use to display each item in the dropdown list.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.Transform
member.summary: The ID of an existing select to convert to a ComboBox.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.TriggerAction
member.summary: The action to execute when the trigger field is activated. Use 'All' to run the query specified by the allQuery config option (defaults to 'Query').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.TypeAhead
member.summary: True to populate and autoselect the remainder of the text being typed after a configurable delay (typeAheadDelay) if it matches a known value (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.TypeAheadDelay
member.summary: The length of time in milliseconds to wait until the typeahead text is displayed if TypeAhead = true (defaults to 250).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.ValueField
member.summary: The underlying data value name to bind to this ComboBox (defaults to undefined if mode = 'remote' or 'value' if transforming a select) Note: use of a valueField requires the user to make a selection in order for a value to be mapped.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.ValueNotFoundText
member.summary: When using a name/value combo, if the value passed to setValue is not found in the store, valueNotFoundText will be displayed as the field text if defined (defaults to undefined).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ComboBoxBase`1.StoreID
member.summary: The data store to use.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.SliderBase.SyncThumb
member.summary: Synchronizes the thumb position to the proper proportion of the total component width based on the current slider value. This will be called automatically when the Slider is resized by a layout, but if it is rendered auto width, this method can be called from another resize handler to sync the Slider if necessary.

member.summary: The paging status message to display (defaults to 'Displaying {0} - {1} of {2}'). These tokens should be preserved when overriding this string if showing those values is desired.

member.summary: Fires after the Panel has been visually activated. Note that Panels do not directly support being activated, but some Panel subclasses do (like Ext.Window). Panels which are child Components of a TabPanel fire the activate and deactivate events under the control of the TabPanel.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.PanelListeners.BeforeClose
member.summary: Fires before the Panel is closed. Note that Panels do not directly support being closed, but some Panel subclasses do (like Ext.Window). This event only applies to such subclasses. A handler can return false to cancel the close.

member.summary: Fires after the Panel has been collapsed.

member.summary: True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove itself.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BaseListener.Buffer
member.summary: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is not invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BaseAjaxEvent.Type
member.summary: The type of AjaxEvent to perform. The 'Submit' type will submit the <form> and 'Load' will make a POST request to url set in the .Url property, or the current url if the .Url property has not been set.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BaseAjaxEvent.FormID
member.summary: The id of the form to submit. If this.ParentForm is not null then this.ParentForm.ClientID is used, else if FormID is empty then FormID is used, else try to find the form in dom tree hierarchy, otherwise the Url of current page is used.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BaseAjaxEvent.Timeout

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ColumnModel.SetRenderer(System.Int32,Coolite.Ext.Web.Renderer)
member.summary: Sets the rendering (formatting) function for a column. See Ext.util.Format for some default formatting functions. Parameters: col : Number The column index fn : Function The function to use to process the cell's raw data to return HTML markup for the grid view. The render function is called with the following parameters: value : Object The data value for the cell. metadata : Object An object in which you may set the following attributes: css : String A CSS class name to add to the cell's TD element. attr : String An HTML attribute definition string to apply to the data container element within the table cell (e.g. 'style="color:red;"'). record : Ext.data.record The Ext.data.Record from which the data was extracted. rowIndex : Number Row index colIndex : Number Column index store : Ext.data.Store The Ext.data.Store object from which the Record was extracted. Returns: void

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.DataViewBase.LoadingText
member.summary: A string to display during data load operations (defaults to undefined). If specified, this text will be displayed in a loading div and the view's contents will be cleared while loading, otherwise the view's contents will continue to display normally until the new data is loaded and the contents are replaced.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.DataViewBase.MultiSelect
member.summary: True to allow selection of more than one item at a time, false to allow selection of only a single item at a time or no selection at all, depending on the value of singleSelect (defaults to false).

member.summary: A CSS class to apply to each selected item in the view (defaults to 'x-view-selected').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.DataViewBase.SimpleSelect
member.summary: True to enable multiselection by clicking on multiple items without requiring the user to hold Shift or Ctrl, false to force the user to hold Ctrl or Shift to select more than on item (defaults to false).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.DataViewBase.SingleSelect
member.summary: True to allow selection of exactly one item at a time, false to allow no selection at all (defaults to false). Note that if multiSelect = true, this value will be ignored.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.DataProxyAjaxEvents.LoawdException
member.summary:
Fires if an exception occurs in the Proxy during data loading. This event can be fired for one of two reasons: The load call timed out. This means the load callback did not execute within the time limit specified by timeout. In this case, this event will be raised and the fourth parameter (read error) will be null.
The load succeeded but the reader could not read the response. This means the server returned data, but the configured Reader threw an error while reading the data. In this case, this event will be raised and the caught error will be passed along as the fourth parameter of this event.
Note that this event is also relayed through Store, so you can listen for it directly on any Store instance.
AjaxEvents will be called with the following arguments: this : Object
options : Object The loading options that were specified (see load for details). If the load call timed out, this parameter will be null.
arg : Object The callback's arg object passed to the load function
e : Error The JavaScript Error object caught if the configured Reader could not read the data. If the load call returned success: false, this parameter will be null.

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.LoadMask
member.summary: A simple utility class for generically masking elements while loading data. If the element being masked has an underlying Ext.data.Store, the masking will be automatically synchronized with the store's loading process and the mask element will be cached for reuse. For all other elements, this mask will replace the element's UpdateOptions load indicator and will be destroyed after the initial load.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.LoadMask.ShowMask
member.summary: True to create a single-use mask that is automatically destroyed after loading (useful for page loads), False to persist the mask element reference for multiple uses (e.g., for paged data widgets). Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.LoadMask.Msg
member.summary: The text to display in a centered loading message box (defaults to 'Loading...').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.LoadMask.MsgCls
member.summary: The CSS class to apply to the loading message element (defaults to 'x-mask-loading').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.LoadMask.RemoveMask
member.summary: True to create a single-use mask that is automatically destroyed after loading (useful for page loads), False to persist the mask element reference for multiple uses (e.g., for paged data widgets). Defaults to false.

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.RecordField
member.summary: The field definition object which specify field names, and optionally, data types, and a mapping for an Reader to extract the field's value from a data object.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.RecordField.Name
member.summary: The name by which the field is referenced within the Record. This is referenced by, for example the DataIndex property in column definition objects passed to ColumnModel

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.RecordField.Mapping
member.summary:
(Optional) A path specification for use by the Reader implementation that is creating the Record to access the data value from the data object.
If an JsonReader is being used, then this is a string containing the javascript expression to reference the data relative to the Record item's root.
If an XmlReader is being used, this is an Ext.DomQuery path to the data item relative to the Record element.
If the mapping expression is the same as the field name, this may be omitted.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.RecordField.Type
member.summary: The data type for conversion to displayable value

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.RecordField.SortType
member.summary: Sort method

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.RecordField.SortDir
member.summary: (Optional) Initial direction to sort

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.RecordField.Convert
member.summary:
(Optional) A function which converts the value provided by the Reader into an object that will be stored in the Record.
It is passed the following parameters: v : Mixed The data value as read by the Reader.
rec : Mixed The data object containting the row as read by the Reader. Depending on Reader type, this could be an Array, an object, or an XML element.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.RecordField.DateFormat
member.summary: (Optional) A format String for the Date.parseDate function

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.RecordField.DefaultValue
member.summary:
(Optional) The default value passed to the Reader when the field does not exist in the data object
Please pay attention that if you use string const then need wrap like this DefaultValue="'String const'"

member.summary: True to render this property as complex object

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.MessageBox.Prompt(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a message box with OK and Cancel buttons prompting the user to enter some text (comparable to JavaScript's prompt). The prompt can be a single-line or multi-line textbox. If a callback function is passed it will be called after the user clicks either button, and the id of the button that was clicked (could also be the top-right close button) and the text that was entered will be passed as the two parameters to the callback.
member.param: The title bar text

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.MessageBox.UpdateProgress(System.Single,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates a progress-style message box's text and progress bar. Only relevant on message boxes initiated via Ext.MessageBox.progress or Ext.MessageBox.wait, or by calling Ext.MessageBox.show with progress: true.
member.param: Any number between 0 and 1 (e.g., .5, defaults to 0)
The progress text to display inside the progress bar (defaults to '')
The message box's body text is replaced with the specified string (defaults to undefined so that any existing body text will not get overwritten by default unless a new value is passed in)

member.summary: A custom CSS class to apply to the message box's container element

member.summary: The default height in pixels of the message box's multiline textarea if displayed (defaults to 75)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.MessageBox.Config.Handler
member.summary: A callback function which is called when the dialog is dismissed either by clicking on the configured buttons, or on the dialog close button, or by pressing the return button to enter input. Progress and wait dialogs will ignore this option since they do not respond to user actions and can only be closed programmatically, so any required function should be called by the same code after it closes the dialog. Parameters passed: buttonId : String The ID of the button pressed, one of: ok yes no cancel text : String Value of the input field if either prompt or multiline is true

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.MessageBox.Config.Fn
member.summary: A callback function which is called when the dialog is dismissed either by clicking on the configured buttons, or on the dialog close button, or by pressing the return button to enter input. Progress and wait dialogs will ignore this option since they do not respond to user actions and can only be closed programmatically, so any required function should be called by the same code after it closes the dialog. Parameters passed: buttonId : String The ID of the button pressed, one of: ok yes no cancel text : String Value of the input field if either prompt or multiline is true

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.CardLayout
member.summary: This layout contains multiple panels, each fit to the contentContainer, where only a single panel can be visible at any given time. This layout style is most commonly used for wizards, tab implementations, etc. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout:'card' Ext.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.CardLayout.DeferredRender
member.summary: True to render each contained items at the time it becomes active, false to render all contained items as soon as the layout is rendered (defaults to false). If there is a significant amount of content or a lot of heavy controls being rendered into panels that are not displayed by default, setting this to true might improve performance.

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.HttpProxy
member.summary:
An implementation of DataProxy that reads a data object from a object configured to reference a certain URL.
Note that this class cannot be used to retrieve data from a domain other than the domain from which the running page was served.
For cross-domain access to remote data, use a ScriptTagProxy.
Be aware that to enable the browser to parse an XML document, the server must set the Content-Type header in the HTTP response to "text/xml".

member.summary: This class is an abstract base class for implementations which provide retrieval of unformatted data objects.

member.summary: Fx config object

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.AfterCls
member.summary: A css class to apply after the effect

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.AfterStyle
member.summary: A style specification string, e.g. "width:100px", that will be applied to the Element after the effect finishes

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.Block
member.summary: Whether the effect should block other effects from queueing while it runs

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.Callback
member.summary: A function called when the effect is finished. Note that effects are queued internally by the Fx class, so do not need to use the callback parameter to specify another effect -- effects can simply be chained together and called in sequence (e.g., el.slideIn().highlight();). The callback is intended for any additional code that should run once a particular effect has completed. The Element being operated upon is passed as the first parameter.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.Concurrent
member.summary: Whether to allow subsequently-queued effects to run at the same time as the current effect, or to ensure that they run in sequence

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.Duration
member.summary: The length of time (in seconds) that the effect should last

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.Easing
member.summary: A valid Easing value for the effect

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.Remove
member.summary: Whether the Element should be removed from the DOM and destroyed after the effect finishes

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.Scope
member.summary: The scope of the effect function

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.StopFx
member.summary: Whether subsequent effects should be stopped and removed after the current effect finishes

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Fx.Config.UseDisplay
member.summary: Whether to use the display CSS property instead of visibility when hiding Elements (only applies to effects that end with the element being visually hidden, ignored otherwise)

If no original color is available, you should provide the "endColor" config option which will be cleared after the animation.

member.summary: The highlight color. Should be a 6 char hex color without the leading # (defaults to yellow: 'ffff9c')

member.summary: Can be any valid CSS property (attribute) that supports a color value

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Highlight.HighlightConfig.EndColor
member.summary: End fading color

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.Puff
member.summary: Fades the element out while slowly expanding it in all directions. When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Scale.Width
member.summary: The new width (pass undefined to keep the original width)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Scale.Height
member.summary: The new height (pass undefined to keep the original height)

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.Shift
member.summary: Animates the transition of any combination of an element's dimensions, xy position and/or opacity. Any of these properties not specified in the config object will not be changed. This effect requires that at least one new dimension, position or opacity setting must be passed in on the config object in order for the function to have any effect.

member.summary: Element's width

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.SlideIn
member.summary: Slides the element into view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the point of origin for the slide effect. This function automatically handles wrapping the element with a fixed-size container if needed.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.SlideIn.Anchor
member.summary: One of the valid Fx anchor positions (defaults to AnchorPoint.CenterTop)

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.SlideOut
member.summary: Slides the element out of view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the end point for the slide effect. When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired. This function automatically handles wrapping the element with a fixed-size container if needed.

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.SwitchOff
member.summary: Blinks the element as if it was clicked and then collapses on its center (similar to switching off a television). When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired.

member.summary: True if sorting is to be handled by requesting the Proxy to provide a refreshed version of the data object in sorted order, as opposed to sorting the Record cache in place (defaults to false). If remote sorting is specified, then clicking on a column header causes the current page to be requested from the server with the addition of the following two parameters: sort: String - The name (as specified in the Record's Field definition) of the field to sort on. dir : String - The direction of the sort, 'ASC' or 'DESC' (case-sensitive).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.StatusBar.IconCls

The class is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.StatusBar.StatusAlign
member.summary: The alignment of the status element within the overall StatusBar layout. When the StatusBar is rendered, it creates an internal div containing the status text and icon. Any additional Toolbar items added in the StatusBar's items config, or added via add or any of the supported add* methods, will be rendered, in added order, to the opposite side. The status element is greedy, so it will automatically expand to take up all sapce left over by any other items.

member.summary: Fires before the load method's callback is called.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.DataProxyListeners.LoadException
member.summary:
Fires if an exception occurs in the Proxy during data loading. This event can be fired for one of two reasons: The load call timed out. This means the load callback did not execute within the time limit specified by timeout. In this case, this event will be raised and the fourth parameter (read error) will be null.
The load succeeded but the reader could not read the response. This means the server returned data, but the configured Reader threw an error while reading the data. In this case, this event will be raised and the caught error will be passed along as the fourth parameter of this event.
Note that this event is also relayed through Store, so you can listen for it directly on any Store instance.
Listeners will be called with the following arguments: this : Object
options : Object The loading options that were specified (see load for details). If the load call timed out, this parameter will be null.
arg : Object The callback's arg object passed to the load function
e : Error The JavaScript Error object caught if the configured Reader could not read the data. If the load call returned success: false, this parameter will be null.

This class does not provide ways to manipulate the underlying data. The data model of a Grid is held in an Ext.data.Store.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.GridView.GetRowClass
member.summary:
Override this function to apply custom CSS classes to rows during rendering. You can also supply custom parameters to the row template for the current row to customize how it is rendered using the rowParams parameter. This function should return the CSS class name (or empty string '' for none) that will be added to the row's wrapping div. To apply multiple class names, simply return them space-delimited within the string (e.g., 'my-class another-class').
Parameters: record : Record The Ext.data.Record corresponding to the current row index : Number The row index rowParams : Object A config object that is passed to the row template during rendering that allows customization of various aspects of a body row, if applicable. Note that this object will only be applied if enableRowBody = true, otherwise it will be ignored. The object may contain any of these properties: store : Store The Ext.data.Store this grid is bound to Returns: String a CSS class name to add to the row.

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar
member.summary: An updateable progress bar component. The progress bar supports two different modes: manual and automatic.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.Reset
member.summary: Resets the progress bar value to 0 and text to empty string. If hide = true, the progress bar will also be hidden (using the hideMode property internally).

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.Reset(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resets the progress bar value to 0 and text to empty string. If hide = true, the progress bar will also be hidden (using the hideMode property internally).
member.param: True to hide the progress bar

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.SyncProgressBar
member.summary: Synchronizes the inner bar width to the proper proportion of the total componet width based on the current progress value. This will be called automatically when the ProgressBar is resized by a layout, but if it is rendered auto width, this method can be called from another resize handler to sync the ProgressBar if necessary.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.UpdateProgress(System.Single)
member.summary: Updates the progress bar value, and optionally its text. If the text argument is not specified, any existing text value will be unchanged. To blank out existing text, pass ''. Note that even if the progress bar value exceeds 1, it will never automatically reset -- you are responsible for determining when the progress is complete and calling reset to clear and/or hide the control.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.UpdateProgress(System.Single,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the progress bar value, and optionally its text. If the text argument is not specified, any existing text value will be unchanged. To blank out existing text, pass ''. Note that even if the progress bar value exceeds 1, it will never automatically reset -- you are responsible for determining when the progress is complete and calling reset to clear and/or hide the control.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.UpdateText
member.summary: Updates the progress bar text. If specified, textEl will be updated, otherwise the progress bar itself will display the updated text.
member.param: The string to display in the progress text element

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.UpdateText(System.String)
member.summary: Updates the progress bar text. If specified, textEl will be updated, otherwise the progress bar itself will display the updated text.
member.param: The string to display in the progress text element

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.Wait
member.summary: Initiates an auto-updating progress bar. A duration can be specified, in which case the progress bar will automatically reset after a fixed amount of time and optionally call a callback function if specified. If no duration is passed in, then the progress bar will run indefinitely and must be manually cleared by calling reset.

member.name: M:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.Wait(Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.WaitConfig)
member.summary: Initiates an auto-updating progress bar. A duration can be specified, in which case the progress bar will automatically reset after a fixed amount of time and optionally call a callback function if specified. If no duration is passed in, then the progress bar will run indefinitely and must be manually cleared by calling reset.
member.param: Configuration options

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.BaseCls
member.summary: The base CSS class to apply to the progress bar's wrapper element (defaults to 'x-progress')

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.Text
member.summary: The progress bar text (defaults to '')

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.TextEl
member.summary: The element to render the progress text to (defaults to the progress bar's internal text element)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.Value
member.summary: A floating point value between 0 and 1 (e.g., .5, defaults to 0)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.Listeners
member.summary: Client-side JavaScript EventHandlers

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.AjaxEvents
member.summary: Server-side Ajax EventHandlers

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.WaitConfig.Duration
member.summary: The length of time in milliseconds that the progress bar should run before resetting itself (defaults to undefined, in which case it will run indefinitely until reset is called)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.WaitConfig.Interval
member.summary: The length of time in milliseconds between each progress update (defaults to 1000 ms)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.WaitConfig.Increment
member.summary: The number of progress update segments to display within the progress bar (defaults to 10). If the bar reaches the end and is still updating, it will automatically wrap back to the beginning.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.WaitConfig.Text
member.summary: Optional text to display in the progress bar element (defaults to '').

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.WaitConfig.Fn
member.summary: A callback function to execute after the progress bar finishes auto-updating. The function will be called with no arguments. This function will be ignored if duration is not specified since in that case the progress bar can only be stopped programmatically, so any required function should be called by the same code after it resets the progress bar.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.ProgressBar.WaitConfig.Scope
member.summary: The scope that is passed to the callback function (only applies when duration and fn are both passed).

member.name: T:Coolite.Ext.Web.FitLayout
member.summary: This is a base class for layouts that contain a single items that automatically expands to fill the layout's contentContainer. This class is intended to be extended or created via the layout:'fit' Ext.Container.layout config, and should generally not need to be created directly via the new keyword. FitLayout does not have any direct config options (other than inherited ones). To fit a panel to a contentContainer using FitLayout, simply set layout:'fit' on the contentContainer and add a single panel to it. If the contentContainer has multiple panels, only the first one will be displayed.

member.summary: If true the form monitors its valid state client-side and fires a looping event with that state. This is required to bind buttons to the valid state using the config value formBind:true on the button.

member.summary: An Ext.data.DataReader (e.g. Ext.data.XmlReader) to be used to read data when reading validation errors on "submit" actions. This is completely optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON.

member.summary: The HTTP method to use. Defaults to POST if params are present, or GET if not.

member.summary: An Ext.data.DataReader (e.g. Ext.data.XmlReader) to be used to read data when executing "load" actions. This is optional as there is built-in support for processing JSON.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.AnimFloat
member.summary: When a collapsed region's bar is clicked, the region's panel will be displayed as a floated panel that will close again once the user mouses out of that panel (or clicks out if AutoHide = false). Setting animFloat to false will prevent the open and close of these floated panels from being animated (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.AutoHide
member.summary: When a collapsed region's bar is clicked, the region's panel will be displayed as a floated panel. If autoHide is true, the panel will automatically hide after the user mouses out of the panel. If autoHide is false, the panel will continue to display until the user clicks outside of the panel (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.CMarginsSummary
member.summary: A string containing margins to apply to the region's collapsed element. Example '5 0 5 0' (addToStart, Right, Bottom, Left)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.CMargins
member.summary: An object containing margins to apply to the region's collapsed element.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.CollapseMode
member.summary: By default, collapsible regions are collapsed by clicking the expand/collapse tool button that renders into the region's title bar. Optionally, when collapseMode is set to 'mini' the region's split bar will also display a small collapse button in the center of the bar. In 'mini' mode the region will collapse to a thinner bar than in normal mode. By default collapseMode is undefined, and the only two supported values are undefined and 'mini'. Note that if a collapsible region does not have a title bar, then collapseMode must be set to 'mini' in order for the region to be collapsible by the user as the tool button will not be rendered.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.Collapsible
member.summary: True to allow the user to collapse this region (defaults to false). If true, an expand/collapse tool button will automatically be rendered into the title bar of the region, otherwise the button will not be shown. Note that a title bar is required to display the toggle button -- if no region title is specified, the region will only be collapsible if CollapseMode is set to 'Mini'.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.Floatable
member.summary: True to allow clicking a collapsed region's bar to display the region's panel floated above the layout, false to force the user to fully expand a collapsed region by clicking the expand button to see it again (defaults to true).

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.MarginsSummary
member.summary: An string containing margins to apply to the region. Example '5 0 5 0' (addToStart, Right, Bottom, Left)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.Margins
member.summary: An object containing margins to apply to the region.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.MinHeight
member.summary: The minimum allowable height in pixels for this region (defaults to 50)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.MaxHeight
member.summary: The maximum allowable height in pixels for this region

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.MaxWidth
member.summary: The maximum allowable width in pixels for this region.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.MinWidth
member.summary: The minimum allowable width in pixels for this region (defaults to 50)

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.UseSplitTips
member.summary: True to display a tooltip when the user hovers over a region's split bar (defaults to false). The tooltip text will be the value of either SplitTip or CollapsibleSplitTip as appropriate.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.CollapsibleSplitTip
member.summary: The tooltip to display when the user hovers over a collapsible region's split bar. Only applies if UseSplitTips = true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.Split
member.summary: True to display a SplitBar between this region and its neighbor, allowing the user to resize the regions dynamically (defaults to false). When split = true, it is common to specify a minSize and maxSize for the region.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.BorderLayoutRegion.SplitTip
member.summary: The tooltip to display when the user hovers over a non-collapsible region's split bar. Only applies if UseSplitTips = true.

member.name: P:Coolite.Ext.Web.Notification.Config.ShowMode
member.summary: Determines how the Notification Windows will be shown in relation to each other if more than one rendered to the viewport at a single time. Options include "Grid" which will show each individual separately in a matrix and new Notification Windows will be shown in the best available empty hole within the grid. Best available is considered bottom-right. If ShowMode.Stack, the Notification Windows will be stacked on top of each other hiding the Window below.

Data reader class to create an Array of Ext.data.Record objects from an XML document based on mappings in a provided Ext.data.Record constructor.
